summary: The Provider Training in Palliative Care Act (S. 2521) introduced in the U.S. Senate aims to allow participants in the National Health Service Corps to defer their obligated service in order to receive training in palliative care services. It amends the Public Health Service Act to allow the Secretary to grant deferrals of up to one year to individuals in the Scholarship Program or Loan Repayment Program who seek palliative care training.
